thread.title: Super SPAR wins Standerton soccer league | Ridge Times
thread.title_full: Super SPAR wins Standerton soccer league | Ridge Times

author: Print Content
title: Super SPAR wins Standerton soccer league | Ridge Times
text:
The Standerton Super League ended after Super SPAR beat Master Villa 1-0. The final playoffs kicked off on November 18, with Ebafaneni facing the Giants.
Another game followed on November 19, when the SAPS took on Afgri. At the end of the season, Super SPAR topped the charts with 50 points.
Master Villa ended second with 46 points. The SAPS finished the season in third place, with 35 points.
The Department of Correctional Services earned 32 points to finish fourth place. Meadow Feeds, with 28 points, took fifth place.
The Standerton Super SPAR sponsored the tournament.
A Super SPAR player throws the ball towards his teammate. Photo: Zell-Mari de Jager Super SPAR and Master Villa go for the ball. Photo: Zell-Mari de Jager A Master Villa player attempts to steal the ball. Photo: Zell-Mari de Jager Master Villa ended the soccer season in second place. Photo: Zell-Mari de Jager Master Villa kicks off the game. Photo: Zell-Mari de Jager Mayor Sifiso Mngemezulu greets the players. Photo: Zell-Mari de Jager A Master Villa player kicks the ball away from the clutches of Super SPAR. Photo: Zell-Mari de Jager Players run at after the ball. Photo: Zell-Mari de Jager
